Data Share:
1. While we may collect some non-personal information, we do not link it to personal data. We do not store personal information, thus we don?t disclose your personal information. However, non-personal information could be disclosed to our trusted partners for promotional purposes. They must comply with this privacy policy and relevant privacy laws.
2. The apps, services, and site may interface with third-party info, like social account information. Although some third-party sites may carry our logo, they aren?t operated or maintained by us. This policy doesn't cover the privacy practices of these websites.
3. For advertisements in our apps, we use Google Admob, Facebook & Startapp. Programing errors could potentially cause unwanted side effects.
4. We follow the rules of the EU User Consent Policy and obtain necessary consent. Our privacy policy may change over time, updates will be posted on this page.
Data Collect:
When using Sparking Lions Club LLC mobile applications on Android, we collect certain data for providing a personalized, useful, and efficient user experience. These include
1. Device-specific details like your hardware model, operating system version, and device settings necessary for some app functionalities.
2. Certain personal data, such as your social network details, device's gallery pictures, contacts, GPS location when needed, and microphone usage.
3. We do not collect or store sensitive personal information about you. To provide features and core functionality of our apps, we use permissions like READ_PROFILE, READ_CONTACTS, WRITE_CONTACTS, READ_CALL_LOG, WRITE_CALL_LOG, and PROGRESS_OUTGOING_CALL. However, we do not retrieve or store your personal information.
4. We use third-party services including Google Play Services, AdMob, Facebook & Firebase Analytics, which may gather information used to identify your device. We may require personally identifiable information for better user experience. It is, however, retained on your device and not collected by us.

- ‍Device Information: Hardware model, unique device identifier, and mobile network information.
- ‍Positional Information: User's actual location derived from IP addresses and GPS.
- Reading Information: Notes, browsing history, and book preview history.
- Use of Collected Information: Collected information is used to provide and maintain services, as well as to develop new ones. It also helps in offering customized content like preferred book genres. Device information helps set up an initial iReader account, and positional information enhances the social pleasure of the product. Information usage is also intended to ensure information security.
- Authorization and Collecting Resources: During installation, iReader requires some authorizations to access system resources. These authorizations include:
- Media and Files: For storing downloaded books.
- Camera: For scanning purposes in identifying electronic versions of liked books in the iReader store.
- WLAN Connection Information: For recommending large size plug-ins download.
- Device ID: For initializing the iReader Guest account.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
(i) CASIO ID Data: App requires CASIO ID registration with name, email address for login purposes. Only this information is transferred from CASIO ID to App.
(ii) Profile Data: Collected and used voluntarily provided data, including birth date, height, weight, and gender.
(iii) Product Information: PLMN, serial number, model name, time zone, system and setting data of combined product with the App are collected and used.
(iv) Uploaded Data: Images, pictures, videos, texts, and other uploaded information are collected if provided on the App.
(v) Device Data: Collected and used are system or setting data, device identifier, model name, OS version, setting data of the Device, and user usage data including date and time of usage and access to the App.
(vi) Location Data: GPS, GNSS location data, Wi-Fi status information are collected if location access is granted. Also identify location via GPS, GNSS, Wi-Fi points, and mobile/cell tower triangulation.
(vii) Activity Data: Data relating to health status like heart rate, steps taken, VO2max, sleep stages, location data, date and time of activity are collected and varies per Product. Data is transferred from Product to server during sync.
(viii) Form Data: Any other individual-related information provided in various forms are collected.
Data Collect:
(i) CASIO ID Data: CASIO ID required for App usage, including name and email address.
(ii) Profile Data: User-registered information including birth date, height, weight, gender, and other input data.
(iii) Product Information: PLMN, serial number, model name, time zone, system and setting data from the associated product.
(iv) Uploaded Data: User provided images, videos, texts, and other uploaded information.
(v) Device Data: System/setting data and device-specific credentials including identifier, model name, OS version, setting data, date/time of usage, and user activity data.
(vi) Location Data: GPS and GNSS coordinates, Wi-Fi access point details and mobile/cell tower triangulation data when location access is granted.
(vii) Activity Data: Health status data including heart rate, steps taken, VO2max, sleep stages, location data, date/time of activity, and other sensor-recorded data.
(viii) Form Data: Any other individual-related data provided in various form submissions is collected.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
1. Loyalty Program Management: We use your data to manage your loyalty program account, verify your identity, and provide you relevant rewards through points, vouchers and coupons as our loyal customer.
2. Personalized Experience: Your information helps us understand your shopping patterns, interactions, preferences and browsing behavior on our app and websites. This helps us curate a tailored shopping experience, relevant marketing, personalized offers, and targeted online advertising.
3. Safety and Security: Personal information enables us to maintain safe and secure workplaces and shopping environments. It aids in using CCTV, monitoring online behavior, verifying customer genuineness, preventing fraud and encouraging appropriate service usage.
4. Analytics and Profiling: We rely on your data for statistical analysis to better understand our customers. Analysis of the products and services you purchase and your consumption patterns help us improve our services, stores, app and websites, and provide you with more relevant offers.
5. Contact: Your personal information is used to contact you for market research, product and service updates, handling inquiries and feedback, and discussing your account status.
Data Collect:
1. Loyalty Program Data: This includes your account details, loyalty points, vouchers and coupons related information.
2. Personalized Experience Data: We collect data about your shopping history, your interactions with us, the places you shop at, products and services you buy, and your use and browsing patterns on our websites.
3. Safety and Security Data: To maintain safety, we collect data from CCTV footages, your online behavior and conduct checks to authenticate customers.
4. Analytics and profiling data: This encompasses data about your product and service purchases, your consumption behavior and patterns.
5. Contact Information: We gather your personal contact data for purposes of market research, communication regarding products and services, and to address any questions or feedback you might have.

If you reject our cookies, some parts of the Service may be inaccessible. For payment transactions, we receive information including payment receipts from app stores or third-party payment processors. We also collect device-specific information when you use our Services - hardware model, operating system, browser information, IP address, mobile network details, and device identifiers. We gather device location data, if you use our location-based features or for troubleshooting. In addition, we collect data about your online status and changes, like when you were last online, and when you last updated your status message.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share: No relevant content available.
Data Collect: Information about cookies
Cookies are text files containing small amounts of data, downloaded to your device when you visit a website. Consequently, every time you return to the site, these cookies are delivered back to the originating website, or to any other website that identifies that cookie. They help a website to recognize a user's device and execute diverse tasks, like facilitating efficient navigation between pages, remembering user preferences, and enhancing the overall user experience. They further assist in making sure the online advertisements you see correspond to your interests.
There are two types of cookies: persistent and session cookies. Persistent cookies stay on your device for a predetermined period and are triggered every time you revisit the website that created them. Conversely, session cookies tie the actions of a user during a browser session which begins when a user opens and ends when they close the browser window. These cookies are temporary and deleted once you close your browser.

Data Share:
Content: The user's contact email is used to respond to feedback or inquiries. After logging in through the app, the user's email and phone number are bound to their account, securely stored on our server, and used for account related functionalities. While calls are made through the app, the dialed number is securely transmitted to the server to facilitate the call. The dialed number is only used during the call and is not stored on the server.
Data Collect:
Content: Information collected when the application is used includes the IP address, device ID, advertising ID, and the operating system of the device. Application usage information, such as frequency and features used, may also be collected to gain insights and enhance the application. After logging in through the email, the email is bound to the account and securely saved on the server. The same is done for the phone number if it is set up in the app. If the app’s call recording feature is used, the call recording is only saved on the user's phone and not on the server. The dialed number and call record are not stored on the server.

Sipdroid uses your entered SIP account name and password to register and authenticate calls with your SIP provider. It doesn't store or transfer any personal data. If call recording is enabled, recorded calls will be stored locally on your SD card.
Optional permissions such as Camera and Storage can be manually enabled based on your needs. Camera permission is required for video calls, and storage permission is required for importing settings and call recording.
Data Collect:
Sipdroid requests Phone and Record Audio permissions at startup. Phone permission allows access to call log and is used in several features such as proxying calls made through the OS dialer to VoIP, labeling ongoing calls on screen, and adding names to missed notifications. Record Audio is required for making voice calls.
Sipdroid does not collect or have access to your device's phone number, IMEI, or IP. The IP address is used solely for signaling to your SIP server for registration and making calls.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
The Call Filter application does not receive, use, or store any personal data or phone identifiers, including SIM card numbers, IMEI and MAC addresses, or any other IDs.
Data Collect:
The Call Filter application is designed to request and use the minimal number of permissions. Only one mandatory and one recommended permission are required for full functionality. On Android versions 7, 8, and 9, the Default Call App permission is needed, allowing the app to process the incoming call number and check it against the unwanted numbers database. For Android 10 and above, the Default Spam Blocker App permission is needed. The Read Contacts permission is not essential, but will be requested if the user enables the Ignore contacts option in the settings. In this event, the Call Filter will access contacts only when there is an incoming call to check if the call number is in the contacts. No other interaction with contacts will be performed by the application. We recommend that you enable this option for more efficient application performance.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
The only instance we may access your Personally Identifiable Information (PII) is when you choose to share your feedback or send us a bug report via email. In this situation, we restrict the collected PII to your name, email address, and your survey responses. This information will only be utilized for improving our services and communicating with you. Your PII will never be used for marketing our products, nor will it be disclosed to any third party for commercial advantage. If you have feedback or require detailed information about our privacy policy, feel free to reach us at tinyentertainment2019@gmail.com.
In terms of your SMS and MMS messaging data, we do not collect, store or share these messages. All messages, including your phone number, are transited via your mobile carrier, not by us. We also do not collect or store your contact/address book information, it is only accessed to associate contact names and pictures with your conversations and messages.
Third-party data including Android Advertising ID, Browser, IP address, Phone model, Language, Mobile Carrier, Screen Resolution, Phone Orientation, WiFi or Mobile Connection, and Android version may be collected by our third-party advertising providers for showing relevant advertisements. However, these providers do not have the right to collect user data for personalized ads unless user consent is provided.
Data Collect:
The PII we may collect is limited to your name and email address when voluntarily provided by you for sending feedback or providing a bug report. We do not collect or store personally identifiable information on our servers.
Your phone number is collected and stored on your device to help users block unwanted phone numbers. However, this information is never uploaded or stored on our servers.
Our third-party advertising providers may collect specific data including Android Advertising ID, Browser, IP address, Phone model, Language, Mobile Carrier, Screen Resolution, Phone Orientation, WiFi or Mobile Connection, and Android version. This information is used for showing more targeted advertising and combined with tracking and anti-fraud technologies.
Additionally, our app may require certain Android device permissions including reading contacts, writing external storage, reading phone state, and accessing SMS, MMS or Internet connectivity. These permissions enable the App to provide a streamlined and responsive user experience, but no personal data is stored on our servers. Any collected data is used solely for providing services to the users. Upon acceptance of our service terms, your phone number extracted from your SIM card is privately sent to our server via a secure SSL encrypted connection.

Server logs are only used for maintenance and to generate anonymous access statistics.

Data Share:
While buying and using the ScanMaster or MotoScan applications, no user information is collected or transferred to third parties. Instead, the purchase contract is concluded with Google, and only Google receives user information following Google's data protection agreement. The application may ask for a debug log from the user for debugging and troubleshooting purposes. The debug log, if shared, comprises the application name and version, OBD2 communications (details about the user's scan tool and vehicle), user's email address, and any error messages that have occurred while using the application. This data is used solely to solve the issues the user is experiencing with the app.
Data Collect:
The privacy policy of ScanMaster or MotoScan apps ensures that no information is collected directly from users, nor are third parties involved in any data collection. The only event in which the users' data is collected occurs if users choose to send a debug log for the purpose of troubleshooting. This log includes: the application's name and version, OBD2 communications (details about the scan tool and vehicle), user's email address, and any error messages that occurred during app usage. The policy clarifies that no anonymous information is collected from the user. The applications implement security measures whereby sensitive user information is encrypted and securely transmitted, while computers/servers storing this data are protected in a secure environment. Updates on privacy policy are communicated via postings on the relevant page.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
The personal data shared by users are disclosed to the following parties:
a) Law enforcement bodies, regulatory, government, court, or other third parties where obligated.
b) Any other individuals with the explicit consent of the user.
c) Third-party service providers and partners who perform data storage, processing services or data-related services on behalf of the company.
Moreover, personal data may be disclosed if the number is available for search in a public database, or the number has been linked to a user who has consented to their number and profile information being available for search and publication.
Data Collect:
The company collects personal data in several ways.
1. Information users provide voluntarily: This may include contact and correspondence information such as name and email address, username and password, profile information like profile photo and biography, and other data users choose to give.
2. Information shared by users: Users share information such as messages, media files, and comments through the services. Phone number, username, and profile information may be available to all users.
3. Information collected automatically: This includes data and analytics about the use of services, IP address and mobile device identifiers, data about the device such as name and operating system, data collected with cookies and similar technologies, broad geographical location based on IP address, precise geolocation data, and data about the use of the services.
4. Information obtained from third-party sources: For instance, if a user links a third-party tool with the services, demographic data, data to fight fraud, data from platforms that services run on, and data for advertising and analytics purposes.
It's worth noting that the company does not request or intend to collect any special or sensitive categories of personal data and does not store any passwords created for third-party services.

Data Share:
XCastLabs ensures customer or subscriber information confidentiality in accordance with legal obligations and moral responsibilities. The company doesn't disclose customer information to any third-party for commercial purposes, unless when customers express interest in disclosure. Disclosure also occurs to comply with local, state, or federal laws. Usually, subscribers are notified about the court order and given sufficient notice to respond. Occasionally, XCastLabs may receive probable cause warrants in criminal investigations, which prohibit the company from alerting the customer.
Data Collect:

This information includes customer or subscriber names, addresses, phone numbers, emails, and certain credit information for non-prepaid services. Each customer has a unique password for individual account access, ensuring privacy. The company may also be responsible for capturing call records or administrative data associated with a specific subscriber account under court order.

This information is then sent to a third-party server to check operator affiliation. Also, when communication functions are activated, during each call, these numbers are collected to identify the telecom operator. Additionally, usage data for the application is required by "AdMob" ads to advertise relevant products and services. All personal information use is subject to user consent. However, OSHEMB does not collect or store any personal information such as email or name, and remains unaccountable for information collection by advertisers and shown adverts.

Data Share:

Our applications use third-party advertisement libraries which require internet access to showcase advertisements, therefore, some access permissions are necessary. While we may use personal information such as user-provided images for styling within the app, we assure users this data is not shared with any third-party libraries. Access to the camera is required to assist users in capturing pictures for editing or QR code scanning. Storage access is essential to save users' work in the SD card and access files from mobile storage. Lastly, the microphone is used only for converting listened content into text, without storing these recordings or user information on our servers. Notification access may be requested to facilitate text receipt from notifications.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
1. Identifiers like device identifier, advertising ID, IP address, name, email address, social media identifier, and username are shared with third-party social networks, advertising networks or data analytics providers, who use cookies or other tracking technologies installed in our apps and websites.
2. Apart from this, user communications such as emails or social media interactions also provide personal identifiers.
3. Commercial information including transaction details and purchase history (excluding payment info) are shared with third-parties who use tracking technologies in our apps.
4. Information relating to users' electronic activity, such as interactions with the application or any associated advertisements are also shared.
5. Geolocation data, discerned from the user's IP address is also shared with third parties.
Data Collect:
1. Personal identifiers such as device ID, advertising ID, IP Address, name, email address, social media identifier, and username are collected for internal analytics and reporting, app operations, maintaining and enhancing service, debugging, detecting or protecting against security events, product development or improvement, internal research, customer service, user acquisition, advertising and direct marketing, detecting or protecting against security events, preventing fraud, abuse of policies and for compliance and legal/regulatory requirements.
2. User information in customer records is collected directly from users through emails.
3. Commercial information, excluding user payment info, is collected mainly to track transaction information and purchase history.
4. Internet/electronic activity data is collected for studying interactions with the application or advertisements. Data is also captured from web hosting service temporary logs.
5. Geolocation data, derived from the user's IP address, such as country, state, and city are collected.

Data Share:
Section Content:
Your account information, including any updates, corrections, or deletions, can be managed at any time either through your online account or by emailing us at support@directcareinnovations.zendesk. Data Collect:
Section Content:

You can stop the collection of location information at any time by modifying the preferences on your mobile device. However, doing so may disable certain features of our mobile applications or prevent them from working altogether.
By default, most web browsers are set to accept cookies, which we use to optimize our Services. If you wish, you may set your browser to remove or reject browser cookies, but doing so could affect the availability and functionality of our Services.

Data Share:
Your Choices
Account Information
By logging into the online account, users can update, correct, or delete their information. Requests for account deactivation or deletion should be sent to support@directcareinnovations.zendesk.com. Certain information may be retained as per law requirements or for legitimate business purposes. Cached or archived copies of user information may also be retained for a specific time period.
Promotional Communications

Data Collect:
Location Information
Users will be asked for consent before the collection of location information when the applications are first launched. This information is mandatory for using the Services; non-consenting users can't use the services. The collection can be stopped at any time by changing device preferences, which might affect application functionality. Removal of mobile applications from the device will also stop location information collection.
Cookies
Web browsers by default accept cookies. Users can adjust their browser settings to remove or reject cookies if they prefer. Note that changes in cookie settings can influence availability and functionality of Services.
Mobile Push Notifications/Alerts
With user consent, promotional and non-promotional push notifications or alerts can be sent to their mobile device. These messages can be deactivated at any time by changing the notification settings on the mobile device.

Lastly, the collection occurs through Targeting cookies that record user activity on the site or services. This recorded data includes the pages visited and the links followed.

RD-Service is not collecting any personal data such as account passwords or bank information on the developer server, hence, we will not share your personal information with third parties. However, the service is designed to capture biometric data for Aadhaar authentication, converting it into a signed and encrypted format before sharing with third-party applications. This biometric data is encrypted with the UIDAI public key certificate and can only be decrypted by the UIDAI itself. No intermediate or third party can utilize this data. When initiating a call to RD service for capturing biometric data from a third-party application, the user must make sure the third-party application collects explicit user consent before capturing biometric data.

These data are utilized for no other purpose. Biometric data capture using the biometric scanner for Aadhaar authentication is encrypted and converted into a secure format. It is noteworthy that this biometric data is encrypted and is not accessible to any third party or intermediary. The third-party application which initiates data collection from RD service is responsible for gaining explicit user consent.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
We take the responsibility as a custodian of your data extremely seriously. Backups are replicated to at least two physical data centers. We utilize industry-standard physical and remote security, ensuring data safety. Access to servers and customer data is strictly controlled and we maintain an immutable audit trail for support-related data access. Upon customer data deletion, it is immediately removed from our databases. Each incident of access or alteration to customer data is logged and maintained for a year. We adhere to best practices in security, with secured inter-server and inter-data center communications, and we manage an active public program on HackerOne for responsible security disclosure.
Data Collect:
We prioritize the privacy and the protection of the data provided to us by our customers. Sensitive information is never exchanged in a plain-text format as all Harvest and Forecast accounts use secure SSL-encrypted connections. Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
a. We share data with third parties when you click on their offers on our websites, providing the necessary information for the offer (like the fact that you found the offer with us and any additional information already input on our website).
b. We only transmit data to social networks like Facebook and Twitter if you activate the respective plugin when you visit our websites. If you're logged in to the network at the time, the visit can be linked with your account. You can prevent this link by logging out of the network before activating the plugin. The plugin remains active until you deactivate it or delete your cookies.
c. If you click a link or activate a social plugin, your personal data may reach providers outside the European Economic Area (EEA) which may not meet European Union's (EU) personal data protection standards.
d. Qualified service providers (like IT service providers, marketing agencies) who help operate, optimize, and secure our websites also have access to personal data as necessary. You can find more information about recipients of personal data in our "Settings" section.
Data Collect:
a. User data transfer to social networks (such as Facebook and Twitter) occurs only when you choose to use a social network plugin available on our websites. The network can connect your visit to our websites with your user account if you're logged in while activating the plugin.
b. Activating a social plugin also initiates a data transmission controlled by that network, governed by the network's privacy policies.
c. Clicking on an offer link or activating a social plugin may allow personal data to be transferred to providers outside of the EEA, which might not offer the same level of protection as the EU.
d. Personal data might be shared with our trusted service providers, for operational and legal reasons, or if you provide consent.

Data Share:
We may share your data with third parties when you interact with their services on our website, such as clicking on their offers. These providers may also receive additional information as required (e.g., that you found their offer through us and any further info provided). We also use social plug-ins from networks like Facebook and Twitter. When you activate these, a direct connection is established with their servers allowing data transfer. The plug-in remains active until you deactivate it or delete your cookies. Data transfer can also occur when you interact on these platforms, governed by their respective privacy policies. Please remember that your data may reach providers outside the European Economic Area, which might not maintain EU's "adequate level of protection" standards.
Data Collect:
We may gather data when you interact with third-party offers on our websites or when you activate social plug-ins. Upon the activation of social plug-ins, your user account, if you're logged in, can be associated with your visit to our websites. We also use qualified service providers (e.g., IT service providers, marketing agencies ) to operate, optimize, and secure our websites, passing on personal data as necessary for the provision, use of the website and its functionalities, for the pursuit of our legitimate interests, to comply with legal obligations, or if you have consented thereto. You can find more information regarding recipients of personal data in our consent management system under "Settings".

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
1. We transfer necessary data to third parties when you engage with their offers on our websites.
2. Social plug-ins such as Facebook and Twitter are initially deactivated; data transmission occurs only when you activate them. Such networks can link your visit to your user account, if logged in while activating the plug-in.
3. Activating a social plug-in involves data transmissions controlled by the respective network, governed by their privacy policies.
4. Personal data could reach providers in non-EU countries, possibly lacking in data protection standards compliant with EU norms, when you engage with a link or social plug-in.
5. We share personal data with service providers (like IT services or marketing agencies) for operations, optimization and security, in compliance with legal obligations, based on legitimate interests or as per your consent.
Data Collect:
1. We collect data about the offers you engage with on our websites. This includes information on third-party offers and whether you found the offer through us, along with additional details provided by you.
2. Upon activation of social plug-ins, the respective network can collect data about your visit linked to your user account.
3. If you activate a social plug-in, data transmission might occur, initiated and controlled by the respective social network. Data collection on connected platforms is governed by their privacy policies.
4. When engaging with a link or social plug-in, the potential exists for personal data to be collected by non-EU providers.
5. For website operations, optimization, security, compliance with legal obligations and with your consent, we collect personal data which is shared with qualified service providers.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
Diarium Privacy Policy states that only aggregated anonymized data is occasionally transmitted to external services to enhance the app. The app might share user information with third parties as outlined in this privacy policy. However, this does not include journal data. While using the Diarium Cloud Sync feature, user databases are uploaded to personal Cloud Storage, such as OneDrive or Google Drive, through official APIs. The third-party Cloud services have their own privacy policies. Services in the "Feeds & Events" section might be connected to augment your journal, and communication to those services is sent encrypted. No personal data is published on your behalf. Diarium accesses your daily step count and sleep data for display in journal entries but does not share this health data with others.
Data Collect:
Diarium collects information during its download and usage such as device's IP address, the Application pages visited, the time and date of visits, time spent on these pages and the operating system used on the device. User data is processed upon consent to this privacy policy, and all data collection ceases when the Application is uninstalled. The application uses Firebase, Sentry, and Mixpanel to monitor app usage, identify bugs, and rectify crashes. Default settings store the journal database on the device, but Diarium Cloud Sync can be chosen to synchronize data across devices. The "Feeds & Events" section is used to enrich your journal data, accessed through official APIs and SSL. Google Fit is used to access daily step count and sleep data when enabled in the app settings. They do not collect personal information from children under the age of 13 deliberately.

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
1. Pincho Nation doesn't sell user's personal data to third parties.
2. The Pincho chain’s franchisees that are connected to the app have access to the personal data provided by ordering in the app or booking on the website.
3. Pincho Nation shares data with various categories of service providers such as service providers of server logs and database services, suppliers of support and communication tools, providers of marketing and online advertising services, etc.

Data Collect:
1. Pincho Nation collects and processes personal data when you log in or create an account, book a table, order, pay, and interact with the app, website or email.
2. Data may also be collected when someone invites you to dine at a Pincho Nation or Pinchos restaurant, gives bonus points, or gives a gift voucher.
3. Information such as name, surname, phone number, booking and order history, restaurant visits, bonus points, email address, date of birth, used offers, and other personal data are processed.
4. In addition, data may be supplemented from personal data supplement services, cookies, pixels, and other tracking technology.
5. Pincho Nation also gathers and processes data to provide and manage services/products, enable and manage payments, register bonus points, identify and verify a member, prevent misuse of the service, and other business reasons.

You can modify your cookie settings through your browser; disabling cookies might affect certain site and service features. If you wish to modify, remove, or opt out of our data records, you can contact us directly. While we retain transaction information, personal data could be removed on your request.
Your personal information might be transferred across states, provinces, or countries where legal jurisdictions differ. We ensure that your data will be treated securely and in accordance with our Privacy Policy no matter where it is stored physically. In certain scenarios, if we undergo merger, acquisition, or asset sale, your personal information may be transferred and subjected to a different Privacy Policy. We retain your personal data only when necessary and adhere to the standards of General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

Privacy Policy:
Data Share:
The collected data from Aspen iSAVE Mobile App is sent to the server located at https://aspen.xemplarinsights.com for the purposes of returning the correct policy information and assessing driving risks for those participating in Aspen's driving safety program.
Data Collect:
The Aspen iSAVE Mobile App collects the following data:
- Policy Information retrieved from Aspen MGA system
- First and Last name from your policy
- Email address that you provide during registration
- Precise Location from your device
- Photographs attached by you when using Claims and Other features
- Technical device information such as model, software version, carrier, battery information, etc.
- Phone sensor/movement data like display status, GPS, Bluetooth, etc.
- GPS / Location Information including coordinates, date and time, actual speed, etc.
- Patterns of application usage, user interaction, and screen views for analytics
- User ID set up by you
- Device ID from your device
- Product interaction data from features you use
- Application Crash data for troubleshooting purposes only
- Application Version to ensure that you have the most recent version.
